summary: The document is a memorandum from Mr. Ramon R. Hart to the Chief of the Support Branch, dated 18 July 1963, detailing the completion of the initial phase of audio surveillance on Manuel F. Artime Buesa at a Bethesda safehouse. It outlines the strategy for continued surveillance upon Artime's return to Washington, D.C., including the technical setup of microphones and a telephone tap, alongside the use of cover stories and the coordination among various individuals and agencies involved in the operation.
key_findings: Completion of the initial phase of audio surveillance on Manuel F. Artime Buesa.
Strategic planning for further surveillance, including technical installations like microphones and a telephone tap, upon Artime's return to Washington, D.C.
Implementation of cover stories and logistical arrangements to support the surveillance efforts.
Collaboration among multiple individuals and agencies to execute the surveillance operation.
